alert.note: Alert for Hunt; Kaufman; Rockwall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 26 at 8:06PM CDT until April 28 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville affecting Hunt County. South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan affecting Hunt, Kaufman and Rockwall Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan. * WHEN...From this evening to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Moderate out of bank flooding will occur. Some farm and cattle industries will be flooded. Some rural roads will be underwater. Water will be over the road and the FM 1565 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 16.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
